page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW-HATHERDEN
page.content: This block comprises of three small villages, Hatherden, Tangley and Wildhern and the land is mainly used for agriculture.There are just over two hundred dwellings and the recent electoral roll showed 453 adults. The only school in the block is at Hatherden and there are 52 children, 28 of them are between 7 and 11 and 24 aged between 5 and 7.There is no shop of any kind but a Post Office can be found in Hatherden. Wildhern has a Methodist Chapel and a village hall with a lovely playing field where the annual Summer Fete is held in July to raise funds for the Tangley and Hatherden churches and the school. A playgroup also meets twice a week in the village hall and money was raised two years ago to provide swings and a climbing frame on the site for younger children.
